title: Maxwell Chalekson
text:
I am an incoming master’s student in Data Science at Boston University, passionate about AI, machine learning, and data-driven problem-solving. At UCLA, I worked on AI reliability and optimization in the Trustworthy AI Lab, analyzing large language models and improving computational efficiency. I have developed AI-driven tools for learning, decision-making, and user experiences, with interests spanning business, education, health, and emerging technologies. I’m particularly fascinated by how AI can optimize human performance and enhance everyday life.
Outside of work, I’m a marathon runner and bouldering enthusiast who enjoys tackling endurance challenges - both in fitness and complex machine learning problems. Always happy to connect and chat about AI, data science, or anything in between! Download my resume here.

title: ALISSTAIR Integration - UCLA STATS 10 Labs
text:
As part of a STATS 199 Directed Research project under Dr. Thomas Maierhofer, I integrated ALISSTAIR, an experimental large language model (LLM), into the STATS 10 labs at UCLA. This project aimed to enhance student learning by leveraging AI to support coding and statistical comprehension.

Key Contributions

Revised all five labs to incorporate AI-driven guidance while maintaining core statistical concepts.
Introduced real-world data sets (e.g., Spotify, Titanic) to improve data literacy and engagement.
Designed prompt engineering sections to teach students how to ask precise AI queries for coding and analysis.
Evaluated ALISSTAIR’s effectiveness, identifying potential misuse and advocating for its integration to improve learning outcomes.

This project will be implemented during the Winter 2026 quarter.
Try ALISSTAIR (Requires ChatGPT subscription)
